metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5866 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Out of bounds memory access in JavaScript in Google Chrome prior to 75.0.3770.142 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5866` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
